benchmark_details.name: DiaHalu
benchmark_details.overview: DiaHalu is a benchmark that evaluates dialogue-level hallucination detection in large language models, covering multiple dialogue domains and hallucination types.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of hallucinations in dialogue generated by LLMs.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Focuses on dialogue-level interactions which may present unique hallucination challenges.

data.source: Various datasets including TruthfulQA, CommonSenseQA, MultiWOZ, DSTC, GSM8K, MathQA
data.annotation: Annotated by professional scholars in the field of NLP.

methods: Manual modification and generation of dialogues using LLMs
methodology.calculation: Calculated F1 scores for hallucination types using standard classification metrics.
methodology.interpretation: Benchmarks performance in detecting hallucinatory content in dialogue.
methodology.validation: Validated through annotation consistency and expert evaluation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data used for dialogue generation does not involve personal data.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All data sources are publicly available.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Adheres to data usage policies of source datasets.
